March 17, 2013: Fiction
CALCULATED IN DEATH, by J. D. Robb. (Putnam, $27.95.) Lt. Eve Dallas must
crunch the numbers as she investigates the death of a successful accountant; by
Nora Roberts, writing pseudonymously.
THE STORYTELLER, by Jodi Picoult. (Emily Bestler/Atria, $28.99.) A New
Hampshire baker finds herself in the midst of two Holocaust stories: her
grandmother’s story of survival, and the confessions of an elderly German man, an
SS officer.
ALEX CROSS, RUN, by James Patterson. (Little, Brown, $28.99.) While Alex Cross
pursues a Washington serial killer (or killers?), someone is after him.
GONE GIRL, by Gillian Flynn. (Crown, $25.) A woman disappears on her fifth
anniversary; is her husband a killer?
A WEEK IN WINTER, by Maeve Binchy. (Knopf, $26.95.) Guests at an inn by the sea
on Ireland’s west coast; the final book by Binchy, who died in 2012.
RED VELVET CUPCAKE MURDER, by Joanne Fluke. (Kensington, $25.) Hannah
Swensen becomes a suspect when her romantic rival turns up dead; recipes
included.
A MEMORY OF LIGHT, by Robert Jordan and Brandon Sanderson. (Tor/Tom
Doherty, $34.99.) The 14th and final novel in the Wheel of Time fantasy series.
THE DINNER, by Herman Koch. (Hogarth, $24.) Two couples meet in an Amsterdam
restaurant to discuss their sons’ criminal activities.
GUILT, by Jonathan Kellerman. (Ballantine, $28.) The Los Angeles psychologist-
detective Alex Delaware and the detective Milo Sturgis pursue the story of a beautiful
nurse.
TENTH OF DECEMBER, by George Saunders. (Random House, $26.) Stories that
take on the big questions.
A DEEPER LOVE INSIDE, by Sister Souljah. (Atria/Emily Bestler Books, $26.99.) A
sequel to “The Coldest Winter Ever” focuses on Winter’s younger sister, Porsche
Santiaga
TOUCH AND GO, by Lisa Gardner. (Dutton, $26.95.) An investigator probing the
disappearance of a seemingly perfect Boston family must dig beneath the surface.
A DANCE WITH DRAGONS, by George R. R. Martin. (Bantam, $35.) After a colossal
battle, the Seven Kingdoms face new threats; Book 5 of "A Song of Ice and Fire."
BAD BLOOD, by Dana Stabenow. (Minotaur, $25.99.) Kate Shugak, an Aleut private
investigator, must sort out murders motivated by revenge between two Alaska towns.
March 17, 2013
Non-Fiction
SALT SUGAR FAT, by Michael Moss. (Random House, $28.) A New York Times
reporter reveals how food companies use science to encourage us to consume
more of their products.
NO EASY DAY, by Mark Owen with Kevin Maurer. (Dutton, $26.95.) An account
by a former member of the Navy SEALs, written pseudonymously, of the mission
that killed bin Laden.
AMERICA THE BEAUTIFUL, by Ben C. Carson and Candy Carson. (Zondervan,
$19.99.) A doctor explores what makes America great.
AMERICAN SNIPER, by Chris Kyle with Scott McEwen and Jim DeFelice.
(Morrow/HarperCollins, $26.99.) A member of the Navy SEALs, recently shot to
death in Texas, discusses his childhood, marriage and battlefield experiences.
MY BELOVED WORLD, by Sonia Sotomayor. (Knopf, $27.95.) The Supreme
Court justice recalls growing up in the Bronx, attending Princeton and becoming a
federal judge.
KILLING KENNEDY, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The host of
“The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the events surrounding the assassination of John F.
Kennedy.
THE SOUNDTRACK OF MY LIFE, by Clive Davis with Anthony DeCurtis. (Simon
& Schuster, $30.) A memoir by the powerful music company executive.
KILLING LINCOLN, by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard. (Holt, $28.) The host of
"The O'Reilly Factor" recounts the events surrounding the assassination of
Abraham Lincoln.
COOLIDGE, by Amity Shlaes. (Harper, $35.) This biography reclaims the 30th
president as a conservative hero.
FRANCONA, by Terry Francona and Dan Shaughnessy. (Houghton Mifflin
Harcourt, $28.) The manager’s Red Sox years.
UNBROKEN, by Laura Hillenbrand. (Random House, $27.) An Olympic runner's
story of survival as a prisoner of the Japanese in World War II.
DAMN FEW, by Rorke Denver and Ellis Henican. (Hyperion, $27.99.) An officer in
the Navy SEALs describes the training program he runs.
WHITEY BULGER, by Kevin Cullen and Shelley Murphy. (Norton, $26.95.) The
criminal career of the notorious Boston gangster, and the manhunt that led to his
capture.
GOING CLEAR, by Lawrence Wright. (Knopf, $28.95.) The Pulitzer Prize-winning
